extracted-table.table-caption: Demographic and clinical baseline characteristics of the patients included in the study.

caption.p: Demographic and clinical baseline characteristics of the patients included in the study.

table-wrap-foot.p: CDSS Calgary depression scale for schizophrenia, eq cpz chlorpromazine equivalent, PANSS positive and negative syndrome scale, resting motor threshold is expressed as a % of maximal stimulator output; SANS scale for the assessment of negative symptoms. Student’s t tests were used to compare demographic and clinical characteristics between the two groups. Sex and handedness proportion differences were assessed using chi-square tests. No differences were observed between patients in the active and sham groups.

extracted-table.table-caption: Brain regions showing significant changes in dorsolateral prefrontal resting-state functional connectivity after active vs. sham stimulation (active stimulation (post-pre) > sham stimulation (post-pre) contrast).

caption.p: Brain regions showing significant changes in dorsolateral prefrontal resting-state functional connectivity after active vs. sham stimulation (active stimulation (post-pre) > sham stimulation (post-pre) contrast).

tr.td: Right superior lateral occipital cortex/angular gyrus

table-wrap-foot.p: BA Brodmann area. Coordinates are given in MNI. The results are thresholded at an uncorrected voxel-level threshold of p < .001 combined with a FWE-corrected p < 0.05 at the cluster level.
